title: Sam Muldrow
text:
Sam Muldrow (born June 8, 1988) is an American professional <a href="basketball">basketball</a> player for the <a href="Windsor%20Express">Windsor Express</a> of the <a href="National%20Basketball%20League%20of%20Canada">National Basketball League of Canada</a> (NBLC). He played college basketball for <a href="South%20Carolina%20Gamecocks%20men%27s%20basketball">South Carolina</a>.
He played 4 seasons of <a href="college%20basketball">college basketball</a> at the <a href="University%20of%20South%20Carolina">University of South Carolina</a>, with the <a href="South%20Carolina%20Gamecocks%20men%27s%20basketball">South Carolina Gamecocks</a>. In March 2011, he was named SEC Defensive Player of the Year.
Professional career.
Muldrow went undrafted in the <a href="2011%20NBA%20draft">2011 NBA draft</a>. On August 16, 2011, he signed with <a href="Aris%20B.C.">Aris Thessaloniki</a> of Greece for the 2011–12 season.
On August 16, 2012, Muldrow signed with <a href="BC%20Dnipro-Azot%20Dniprodzerzhynsk">Dnipro-Azot</a> of Ukraine for the 2012–13 season. On March 19, 2013, he parted ways with Dnipro-Azot and signed with <a href="BC%20Pieno%20%C5%BEvaig%C5%BEd%C4%97s">Pieno žvaigždės</a> of Lithuania for the rest of the season. On August 22, 2013, he re-signed with Dnipro-Azot for the 2013–14 season.
In October 2014, Muldrow signed a two-month deal with an option of extension until the end of the season with <a href="KK%20Metalac%20Valjevo">Metalac Valjevo</a> of Serbia. However, after some problems with registration, club decided to cut him. On November 6, 2014, he signed with <a href="ALM%20%C3%89vreux%20Basket">ALM Évreux Basket</a> of the French <a href="LNB%20Pro%20B">LNB Pro B</a> for the rest of the 2014–15 season. In January 2015, he parted ways with Évreux after appearing in ten games. Later that month, he signed with <a href="Baunach%20Young%20Pikes">Bike-Café Messingschlager Baunach</a> of the German <a href="2.%20Basketball%20Bundesliga">2. Basketball Bundesliga</a> for the rest of the season. In May 2015, he signed with <a href="Titanes%20del%20Distrito%20Nacional">Titanes del Distrito Nacional</a> of Dominican Republic for the 2015 <a href="Liga%20Nacional%20de%20Baloncesto">LNB</a> season.
On July 29, 2015, he signed with <a href="Keravnos%20B.C.">Keravnos</a> of the <a href="Cyprus%20Basketball%20Division%201">Cyprus Basketball Division 1</a>. However two months later, on September 28, 2015, he parted ways with Keravnos before appearing in a game for them. On October 1, 2015, he signed with <a href="KB%20Peja">KB Peja</a> of Kosovo. He left Peja after appearing in eleven <a href="Kosovo%20Basketball%20Superleague">league</a> games and six <a href="Balkan%20International%20Basketball%20League">BIBL</a> games. On March 9, 2016, he signed with the <a href="Niagara%20River%20Lions">Niagara River Lions</a> of the <a href="National%20Basketball%20League%20of%20Canada">National Basketball League of Canada</a>.
On July 21, 2016, Muldrow signed with <a href="Oettinger%20Rockets%20Gotha">Oettinger Rockets Gotha</a> of the German <a href="ProA">ProA</a>. On November 16, 2016, he parted ways with Oettinger after appearing in ten games. On February 7, 2017, Muldrow signed with the Niagara River Lions, returning to the club for a second stint. HE was named to the All-NBLC Defensive Team in 2018. On October 26, 2017, he re-signed with the Niagara River Lions. In the beginning of July 2018, Muldrow signed with the Brazilian team Vasco da Gama. Muldrow continued to play for the Niagara River Lions as they transitioned to the <a href="Canadian%20Elite%20Basketball%20League">Canadian Elite Basketball League</a> (CEBL). He played the 2019 season with the River Lions, leading the team in blocks and fourth on the team for 3-pointers with 30.
Muldrow joined the <a href="Windsor%20Express">Windsor Express</a> in 2019. He averaged 14.4 points, 7.6 rebounds, and 1.7 assists per game, earning Third Team All-NBL Canada honors.
